project_abstract.cdata: On October 8, 2005, a powerful earthquake measuring 7.6 on the Richter scale hit northern Pakistan. Pakistan has borne the brunt of the earthquake, especially 5 northeastern districts of the North West Frontier Province (NWFP) and three districts covering most of had Jammu and Kashmir (AJK), with enormous loss of life and devastation of infrastructure and property.  The Bank is preparing a proposed package of US$ 470 million to help Pakistan deal with the reconstruction effort and safeguard the on-going reform and poverty reduction program, which will include supplemental financing of US$ 150 million under the Poverty Reduction Support Program (PRSC 1) and of US$ 50 million under the Second Structural Adjustment Credit for the North West Frontier Province (NWFP SAC 2). This report covers the proposed Supplemental Financing of US$ 50 million, which will support the sustained implementation of the NWFP SAC2 reform program, and help finance part of the gap in resources incurred as a result of the earthquake. The NWFP SAC 2 is the second in a series of three operations to support the implementation of the Government of NWFP's Provincial Reform Program. The NWFP SAC 2 has been supporting implementation of the provincial government's reform program, and is based on five pillars: (1) Accelerating economic growth and promoting private sector development; (2) Accelerating human development and improving social service delivery; (3) Fiscal reforms; (4) Governance reforms in public financial management and procurement; and (5) Reforms to achieve an efficient, accountable, and service oriented civil service. It is critical that the provincial fiscal framework remains sustainable while relief and rehabilitation takes place.
